reviews.text: just got back from a ten day trip in rome and positiano. was very surprised by the small rooms and "two double beds" (translation, two tiny twins), however, the location was great and the service was excellent....really excellent. front desk staff was above and beyond, always friendly, gracious, and very, very helpful. what lacked in room size was more than made up for with service and location. rooms clean, and no bathroom issues. we would definitely return.
reviews.title: excellent service

reviews.text: Just back from 3 days in Roma. What a great place for a long week-end: Just think about an additional suitcase for your shopping! needless to say a fully loaded credit card if you are traveling with your wife and teenager daughters.... Back to the Ludovisi, truly a great location and friendly staff. However if you are looking for a real 4* you will be disappointed (hot/cold water problem, tiny bathroom, clean as long as you are not too demanding, breakfast is simply acceptable). All in all for the price it's a fair deal.
reviews.title: Great location, great service but rather a 3 stars than a 4

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cheers and enjoy your stay in Rome
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: P.S.: Best practice sharing - be picky in your guide selection (do it in advance with a reputable agency)
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location in Rome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cheers,
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.text: Hotel Ludovisi Palace is a good place to reach almost any part of Rome and its' proximity to the Spanish Steps is one of the highlights of staying at this fine hotel.
reviews.title: nice place, excellent location
Jewelry stolen
reviews.text: The rooms are fine and rather on the small side. We had requested a room with a balcony and were given a nice little room on the top floor but the balcony had a brick facade so the only way you could look out was to climb on a chair. The room was very clean and the staff were all friendly and efficient.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As do almost all hotels in Rome, a complimentary continental breakfast is served. The breakfast offerings were fair and served in two small rooms which are more like sitting parlors than a restaurant, so it was always cramped and crowded.
reviews.title: Super Hotel in a perfect location and lovely staff

reviews.text: All in all not a bad choice for a 3 star hotel in the heart of Rome so location is the key for
reviews.title: Lovely friendly hotel

reviews.text: selecting the Hotel Ludovisi Palace.
reviews.title: Excellent location and service
Nice hotel near the Spanish Steps
reviews.text: This was a nice hotel near the Spanish Steps. It was at least a 15 min walk...to get to the Spanish Steps. The rooms were clean, well appointed and nice. No complaints, just be aware that it is not centrally located. However,the metro is near the hotel and it is in a nice area. If this hotel is in your price range---book it!

reviews.title: Great location and comfortable hotel.
reviews.text: We stayed for a 3 day sightseeing visit to Rome. The breakfasts were buffet style and included pastries, scrambled egg, bacon (a bit oily but edible), cereals, cold meats and yoghurts. The open top bus tours had a stop on the Via Veneto at the end of our road, which was very convenient. We also found the stroll to the Trevi fountain and Spanish Steps in the evenings great for choosing places to eat. One night there was free open air opera singing at the steps - magical. Our room was of a decent size for the three of us and clean. The shower was a bit quirky but functional and the bathroom generally was good with ample room and included a bidet. The heat outside was a crushing 37 degrees but the airconditioning just about coped. The laundry service was reasonable for Rome and prompt. It was described as 4 star, which I would not say it was, more like a 3 star, but having said that we were very happy with our stay.

reviews.title: Scammers
reviews.text: The first day set the pace. We got there and had an argument with the taxi driver for charging us twice what we had agreed to pay befor entering the taxi. Tha hotel manager came out and did nothing to help us with the situation. When we were checking in we asked about the happy hour and appetizers the claim to have everyday on the travel sites. They stated that they do not know what we are talking about and nothing like that exists there. Big let down. This was in fact the one and only reason we chose this hotel. There are thousands of hotels to choose from and this is the ploy they use to get people in. I had expedia call them and the girl at the front desk from the hotel told the girl from expedia that they do still have that promotion and always have. A blatant LIE. This place is a scam and have nothing to to say about these shiesters, crooks, lies,, theives, etc.

reviews.title: Great location, good hotel
reviews.text: We booked at the Hotel Ludovisi Palace as part of a package with our airfare to Italy. I don't know exactly how much the rooms would have cost us independently, but it was a pretty good value, considering what we got.

reviews.title: Small rooms but overall worth it.
reviews.text: We took a train from Fiumcino Airport to Termini station and then took a taxi to the hotel. Total cost for the 2 of us including "baggage handling fees" (the random amount the taxi driver charges you for having suitcases) was appx $70.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spanish Steps: Out the door, turn right; end of street, turn left; next right - Spanish Steps.
reviews.title: ideal in every way

reviews.text: Not only does that describe the ideal placement of the Ludovisi Palace but it sums up the convenience and location of the hotel.
reviews.title: great staff and location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was diverse and, even showing up in the last 30 minutes of the service time, the offerings were fully replenished.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in Room 207 with two double beds and the best water pressure in the shower I've experienced in any hotel no matter the number of stars. The room was more than large enough for two people (or four - with ample closet and drawer space) and, though it faced a boring inner area, there was no street noise which could have been a factor given that Via Ludovisi is a street with a number of tour bus parking spots (though not in front of the hotel itself).
reviews.title: Surprise value and location
Perfect place for families and service with a smile!
reviews.text: As someone else has said, this is a neighbourhood filled with 4 and 5 star hotels yet is not a throughway. Nearly everything is an easy downhill walk from the hotel: Trevi, Coliseum/Forum. Leaving, of course, an uphill walk on the way home. And steps from Rome's version of Hyde Park/Central park.
